intro: Fissistigma guinanense, commonly known as the Guianan fissistigma, is a member of the Rubiaceae family. It is a shrub or small tree native to the tropical regions of South America, particularly in Guyana and Venezuela. The plant features opposite, elliptical leaves with a smooth or slightly hairy surface. Its flowers are small, clustered in cymes, and typically have four petals. The fruit is a capsule that splits open to release small, winged seeds.
